org.jplot2d.axtick

Class TickCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jplot2d.axtick.TickCalculator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DoubleTickCalculator, LongTickCalculator

    public abstract class TickCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    A calculator to calculate tick values and minor tick values.

        public static final double DOUBLE_PRECISION_TOLERANCE
        The Tolerance error for double computing. doublePrecisionLimit is 0x1.0p-52

    • Method Detail

      • getRange

        @Nonnull
public abstract Range getRange()

      • setRange

        public abstract void setRange(@Nonnull
            Range range)

      • calcValuesByTickNumber

        public abstract void calcValuesByTickNumber(int tickNumber,
                          int minorTickNumber)
        Calculate the tick values by the given tick number and minor ticks number. The minor ticks number is a proposed value, and may be different from the actual minor ticks number returned by getMinorNumber().
        Parameters:
        tickNumber - the number of ticks
        minorTickNumber - the number of minor ticks. if the given number is AUTO_MINOR_TICK_NUMBER, the tick number is automatically chosen.

      • calcValuesByTickInterval

        public abstract void calcValuesByTickInterval(double interval,
                            double offset,
                            int minorTickNumber)
        Calculate the tick values by the given interval and minor ticks number. The minor ticks number is a proposed value, and may be different from actual minor ticks number returned by getMinorNumber().
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval between 2 tick values
        offset - the offset from the default tick values
        minorTickNumber - if the given number is AUTO_MINOR_TICK_NUMBER, the tick number is derived from interval.

      • getInterval

        public abstract double getInterval()
        Returns the interval between 2 tick values.
        Returns:
        the tick interval

      • getMinorNumber

        public abstract int getMinorNumber()
        Returns the actual minor tick number.
        Returns:
        the actual minor tick number

      • calcMinorNumber

        protected int calcMinorNumber(int majorInterval,
                  int minorNumber)
        Find a proper minor tick number according to the given tick interval and proposal minor tick number.
        Parameters:
        majorInterval - the tick interval
        minorNumber - the proposed minor tick number
        Returns:
        the proper minor tick number

      • getValues

        @Nonnull
public abstract java.lang.Object getValues()
        Returns an array of tick values.
        Returns:
        the tick values

      • getInRangeValuesIdx

        @Nonnull
public abstract int[] getInRangeValuesIdx(@Nonnull
                                java.lang.Object values)
        Return all index of the given values, which the values are in the range of this calculator.
        Parameters:
        values - the array of values
        Returns:
        a array of index

      • calcLabelTextFormat

        @Nullable
public abstract java.text.Format calcLabelTextFormat(@Nonnull
                                            java.lang.Object values)
        Calculate a proper text format to format the labels on the given values. A calculator can just returns a text format and do not provide a format string (returns a empty string). If The returned text format is null, a proper format string must be provided.
        Parameters:
        values - the values to be formatted
        Returns:
        a text format object

      • calcLabelFormatString

        @Nullable
public abstract java.lang.String calcLabelFormatString(@Nonnull
                                              java.lang.Object values)
        Calculate a proper format string to format the labels on the given values. This method can returns null if calcLabelTextFormat(java.lang.Object) returns a format object.
        Parameters:
        values - the values to be formatted
        Returns:
        a format string

      • getLabelFormat

        @Nullable
public abstract java.lang.String getLabelFormat()
        Returns a proper format string to format the labels on tick values returned by getValues(). Some calculators can derive format from its internal status directly.

      • isValidFormat

        public abstract boolean isValidFormat(@Nonnull
                    java.lang.String format)
        Returns true if the given format is valid for this tick calculator
        Parameters:
        format - the format to be validated

        Returns a formatted string using the specified format string on the given value array.
